text:
Really really affordable handmade fosh paste product. Deep fried freshly!! The last time I came I don't recall having so many varieties, and it's getting more creative!

Our favourite was the flat fish paste as well as the wontons with fish paste. The fishballs are super juicy, bouncy and so rich in fresh fish paste flavours! The price is also so cheap

Bought 3 big fishball, 5 fishcake and 3 fried wanton. Guess so many varieties how much? Only $4.50! We are in 2025 Bro, where to find such good price!? Unbelievable. And the taste is very good too. If you are here please visit and patronize this stall, super worth it.

Very affordable fried food in this crowded hawker centre, even on a weekday morning!

$1.50 for 6 fishball is a win 👍🏻 though I can’t give more than 3 stars for how salty it was when eaten by itself.. probably need to eat this with rice or noodles to keep it down.

Tiong Bahru Fried Fishball has been sprouting all over Singapore of late and I was surprised to find a stall at Kovan Market/Hawker Centre. I am especially fond of their otah fishcakes and beanskin fishcakes. It is one of my favourite go to fried fishballs/fishcakes stall since young at Tiong Bahru Market. This stall at Kovan, #01-60 opens from 730am to 700pm which is almost 12 hours. Support our local hawkers as F&B is a very tedious and laborious task. 💪💪💪

Last week I was there try the indonesia cuisine and I saw this Tiong bahru fried fish ball. I buy some fish ball to try and I love the fish ball texture so yummy. I try the otah fish ball so yummy. I did buy fish cake and I get more otah ball.
Today i back to kovan again and buy more fish ball and fish cake.
The uncle was so friendly and he did answer my question too.
I know where to get yummy fish ball again.

The food store same Direct on Anthony Indonesian Cuisine at kavon.
Give a support 😍😍👍👍
